paper_abstract: We consider the application of the empirical likelihood method to a partial linear model with ARCH(1) errors. It is shown that the empirical log-likelihood ratio at the true parameter converges to the standard chi-square distribution and that the confidence intervals can be constructed accordingly. Some simulations are conducted to illustrate the proposed method. (C) 2012 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Empirical likelihood inference for partial linear models with ARCH(1) errors
